  <b:widget id='HTML5' locked='false' title='Why Hire Hatch Homes to Buy or Sell Your Portland Home?' type='HTML'>
    <b:widget-settings>
      <b:widget-setting name='content'><p>At the Hatch Homes Group your needs are the top priority. John has been living in the Portland area since 1992 and his team is composed of people that have lived in the area their whole lives. He has prestigious CRS accreditation and is also a member of the Real Estate Buyers Agent Council and has earned the Accredited Buyer's Representative (ABR) designation. John and his wife Melody know that buying or selling a home is one of the most important transactions you make, and want to help make that experience as smooth and rewarding as possible.</p>

<p>With over 30 years of sales and marketing experience between them, John and Melody have an extensive business background. To make your life easier they have developed a useful Seller's Guide that will walk you through the entire process of selling your home. They also offer a free market analysis and personalized marketing plan, tailored particularly to your house and area. The team also consists of three dedicated Buyer's specialists that work exclusively with buyers to give their utmost attention to them and their needs.   If you want to work with a team of highly skilled, seasoned, and savvy real estate professionals, give the Hatch Homes Group a call today.</p>

<b><span itemprop="founder">John Hatch</span><br /> 
<span itemprop="brand">Hatch Homes Group</span><br />
<span itemprop="branchof">Keller Williams Realty Professionals</span></b><br />
<span itemprop="address">9755 SW Barnes Rd<br />
Ste 560<br />
Portland, OR 97225</span><br />
<span itemprop="telephone">Phone: (503)-974-4104</span><br />
<span itemprop="fax">Fax: (503)-748-8360</span><br />
<a href="mailto:john@hatchhomes.com"><b>john@hatchhomes.com</b></a></b:widget-setting>
    </b:widget-settings>

  <b:widget id='HTML6' locked='false' title='How Hatch Homes Can Help You Buy or Sell in Portland' type='HTML'>
    <b:widget-settings>
      <b:widget-setting name='content'><![CDATA[<iframe width="360" height="203" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/bETki06vFiQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>]]></b:widget-setting>

  <b:widget id='HTML7' locked='false' title='Hatch Homes Testimonials' type='HTML'>
    <b:widget-settings>
      <b:widget-setting name='content'><center style="font-weight: normal;"><h2><a href="http://hatchhomes.blogspot.com/p/blog-page_11.html"><b>Click to hear recent <br />testimonials </b><b style="font-size: 100%; text-align: left;"><div style="display: inline !important; text-align: -webkit-center;"><b style="font-size: 100%; text-align: left;">from happy clients</b></div></b></a></h2></center><div><p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-raymond-bessemer">Raymond</a></b> - "We had a very comfortable experience with Clare from Hatch Homes. There wasn't any pressure and it was just a very personal experience. In the closing they were always anticipating our needs and were always once step ahead with what we needed to do"</p></div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-barbra-siefkin">Barbara</a></b> - "My experience with John was phenomenal. He came in and did all of the staging for me, I didn’t have to lift a finger, and even before our open house I had 2 offers within 2 days. He had a lot of resources with difference services I might need and he really just held my hand and was my partner in the sale of my home. There’s a reason that he sells a lot of houses and it’s because he just excels at it. I would definitely recommend him!"</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-frank-goulart">Frank</a></b> - "Everything went pretty smoothly and I bought exactly where I wanted. They did a good job of engaging me in the process and always kept me informed. I’ve bought and sold a few properties now, and I think the response time was the best and I never felt like I was waiting around for anything."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-laura-jenson">Laura</a></b> - "They really made great recommendation when we were buying and selling our home. There was a hustle to purchase a home due to the low interest rates and our Realtor handled it very well. They never put pressure on me and were very realistic with us. He really knows the system and just made it very easy on us."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-leah-eberhardt">Leah</a></b> - "Our agent with Hatch Homes was just awesome. She was able to walk us through all of the processes included in the sale of our home and made it less stressful than I thought it would be. She had a lot of energy, she was knowledgeable, and really did a great job for us. She had a passion for what she’s doing and it really shows in the experience that I had with them."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-mary-jean-benefiel">Mary Jean</a></b> - "The whole process was very painless. If we ever had an issue, they were so responsive and were able to solve them quickly which was very nice. His knowledge of the mechanics of the process was much appreciated and we definitely trusted our Realtors to get the job done. "</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-michael-osherow">Michael</a></b> - "This wasn’t my first transaction with the Hatch Homes Group and they’ve always done a great job, especially my Realtor Barry. It’s what he does and he does a great job! He really knows the market and I’ve always have great experiences with them"</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-philip-haleen">Philip</a></b> - "Hatch Home did a good job for me when I was looking to buy my home. They were very nice, polite, accommodating, and friendly. They really seemed to get their work done. They’re very good with their research and they really know what the market is doing. "</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-russell-porter">Russell</a></b> - "Hatch Homes worked with us to find what we wanted in the area that we wanted. They looked all over and found things that were in our area and made sure that it fit our criteria. We found a place that was exactly what we wanted!"</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-tenzin-yeshi">Tenzin</a></b> - "It was actually a very quick process. The Realtor we worked with was very responsive and prompt considering that the market was very competitive at the time. He was very patient and answered any questions I had."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-lynda-wymore">Lynda</a></b> - "There was a bid on the house that we sold that we were going to accept but our Realtor said to wait because she thought there would be another bid on the home. Sure enough, there was another bid that actually didn’t go directly to her so she checked to make sure. It ended up being more money and I was happier with the people that bought the home."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-percy-rose">Percy</a></b> - "We were living in Houston at the time we purchased the home, but we had visited Portland and found a neighborhood that we liked. Barry, our agent, worked on our behalf and constantly communicated with us. Barry even helped us arrange someone to come out and get the place semi-cleaned up before we arrived. We had a really good experience!"</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/john-hatch-reviews-juan">Juan</a></b> - "They were really great and did a very good job for us. We were on the market to purchase a home after we had sold our other property and we were looking in a particular area. John called us on a Sunday morning letting us know that a particular house on was going on the market. We ended up being here at the right moment of the open house and we absolutely loved it and made a bid on it. It was the perfect house for us and he knew it."</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/hatch-homes-reviews-kim-talley">Kim</a></b> - "Clare was superior to work with. She was efficient, only showed me homes that fit my criteria. We were only in town to look at homes for four days, but she has such a streamlined process that we were able to make an offer on the fourth day. It was excellent.
"</p>

</div>
<div>

<p class="right-txt-gadget"><b><a href="https://soundcloud.com/john-hatch-7/hatch-homes-reviews-tyler-case">Tyler</a></b> - "We got great results. She was very organized, and once we made an offer, she kept everything moving. For instance, we wound up with an appraisal that was lower than what we had offered. She was able to come up with a package that worked for us and the sellers, and we were able to get the house at a lower price!
"</p>

</div></b:widget-setting>

          </div>
          <b:include name='quickedit'/>
        </div>
      </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='flat' var='data'>
        <ul class='flat'>
          <b:loop values='data:data' var='i'>
            <li class='archivedate'>
              <a expr:href='data:i.url'>
                <data:i.name/>
              </a>
              (
              <data:i.post-count/>
              )
            </li>
          </b:loop>
        </ul>
      </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='interval' var='intervalData'>
        <b:loop values='data:intervalData' var='i'>
          <ul class='hierarchy'>
            <li expr:class='"archivedate " + data:i.expclass'>
              <b:include data='i' name='toggle'/>
              <a class='post-count-link' expr:href='data:i.url'>
                <data:i.name/>
              </a>
              <span class='post-count' dir='ltr'>
                (
                <data:i.post-count/>
                )
              </span>
              <b:if cond='data:i.data'>
                <b:include data='i.data' name='interval'/>
              </b:if>
              <b:if cond='data:i.posts'>
                <b:include data='i.posts' name='posts'/>
              </b:if>
            </li>
          </ul>
        </b:loop>
      </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='menu' var='data'>
        <select expr:id='data:widget.instanceId + "_ArchiveMenu"'>
          <option value=''>
            <data:title/>
          </option>
          <b:loop values='data:data' var='i'>
            <option expr:value='data:i.url'>
              <data:i.name/>
              (
              <data:i.post-count/>
              )
            </option>
          </b:loop>
        </select>
      </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='posts' var='posts'>
        <ul class='posts'>
          <b:loop values='data:posts' var='i'>
            <li>
              <a expr:href='data:i.url'>
                <data:i.title/>
              </a>
            </li>
          </b:loop>
        </ul>
      </b:includable>
    <b:includable id='toggle' var='interval'>
        <b:if cond='data:interval.toggleId'>
          <b:if cond='data:interval.expclass == "expanded"'>
            <a class='toggle' href='javascript:void(0)'>
              <span class='zippy toggle-open'>
                ▼ 
              </span>
            </a>
            <b:else/>
            <a class='toggle' href='javascript:void(0)'>
              <span class='zippy'>
                <b:if cond='data:blog.languageDirection == "rtl"'>
                  ◄ 
                  <b:else/>
                  ► 
                </b:if>
              </span>
            </a>
          </b:if>
        </b:if>
      </b:includable>
  </b:widget>
</b:section-contents><b:section-contents id='footer-1'/></html>

entry.title: A Few Important Numbers From the Portland Real Estate Market
entry.content:
What is happening in the Portland real estate market? We have six important statistics to share with you today.

Looking to buy a Portland home? Search all homes for sale here.
Looking to sell your Portland home? Use our free home evaluation tool here.


Its time for your Portland real estate market update. There are a few important market statistics that we want to share with you today.


First of all, there are 98 bumpable listings on the market right now. That means that these listings are contingent on something happening on the buyers or sellers side of the transaction in order for the sale to go through.


This is really important. In the past, sellers have been cautious about contingent home offers. Most of the time, sellers would wait to find their next home before putting their current home on the market. Its very promising that there are 98 bumpable listings. With all of those contingent offers, well likely see 98 new homes hit the market soon, which is good news for buyers.


Next, there are 197 expired homes. That means these homes failed to sell in the last few months. As your agents, we look at why those listings failed to sell so that you dont end up in the same situation.


Another important thing to know is that 612 homes are back on the market. Buyers these days are more particular on what they want from a home. They expect the home to be in good condition for a certain price. On the other side, sellers are not willing to negotiate repairs, so these deals are falling apart and those homes are coming back on the market.

That is great news for buyers. Those 612 homes increase inventory. Plus, you may even get a second chance at a home that you liked earlier but didnt get a chance to make an offer on.

There is a disparity between buyers expectations and how sellers view the current market. 

Sellers should take note that in the last week alone, we had 783 price changes. Although Portland is still in a strong sellers market, its not as strong as some people may think. You cant overprice your home in this market, and those 783 price changes prove that. Were here to guide you. We can help you avoid that price adjustment by pricing your home correctly from the start.


Finally, the number of closed sales in July dropped by 12%, while the number of pending sales dropped 7.9%.


All in all, these numbers indicate that our market is shifting into a more balanced, healthy market. We are not in the housing bubble that everyone feared. Prices are still very healthy, and inventory is still fairly low, which makes it a good time to sell your home.


That said, these numbers do show a disparity between buyer expectations and what sellers believe they can get out of the current market. Dont forget those 612 homes that went back on the market after their deal fell apart.


As we mentioned earlier, there is slightly more inventory for buyers to choose from these days. Make sure you take advantage of the updated inventory and low mortgage rates now.

If you have any questions about buying or selling in our current market, just give us a call or send us an email. We would be happy to help you!

link.title: A Few Important Numbers From the Portland Real Estate Market

entry.title: What Is Happening in the Portland Market?
entry.content:
Now that were halfway through the year, I sat down with my daughter, Angela, to give you a look at whats happening in our market.

Looking to buy a Portland home? Search all homes for sale here.
Looking to sell your Portland home? Use our free home evaluation tool here.


Now that were over halfway through the year, its time for us to take a look at whats going on in our market.
Recently, I was joined by my daughter Angela, the team leader for Hatch Homes Group, to talk about why it is that Realtors are feeling a little bit uneasy about certain aspects of the market.

The number of days homes are spending on the market has risen a little bit, more listings have come on the market, and there have been more price reductions, as well. So why is all of this happening?

As Angela explained, its likely caused by an uptick in inventory. She also mentioned, though, that homes that arent priced correctly are the only ones really having a problem getting off the market. Homes that are priced right are moving as quickly as ever and with record-low inventory.

Buyers are more discerning, as well. Right now, buyers are less willing to settle for a property with problems. So, poorly-prepared homes are really struggling when it comes time for them to undergo inspections. For this reason, were experiencing a lot more terminations.

Homes that are priced right are moving as quickly as ever.
   


This is what makes it so important for sellers to meet with Realtors; doing so can help them avoid termination.
With all of this considered, many people are wondering if were in a bubble. Well, we actually saw this same thing happen last year. According to Angela, there is cause to be optimistic.

Sellers who were trying to buy and sell at the same time are now finding themselves in a good position, as there is a little more inventory for them to choose from. The same can be said for buyers, as well.

In fact, this is a better opportunity than weve seen for buyers in a long time. Its also a good opportunity for sellers to get the most out of the market. And, because so many people are attracted to the lifestyle, were continuing to see an influx of population here in Portland.

If you have any other questions or would like more information, feel free to give me a call or send me an email. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

link.title: What Is Happening in the Portland Market?

entry.title: What Advice Do We Have for First-Time Homebuyers?
entry.content:
There is a lot that goes into buying your first home. To make things a little easier, here is my list of tips to keep in mind during the first-time home buying process.

Looking to buy a Portland home? Search all homes for sale here.
Looking to sell your Portland home? Use our free home evaluation tool here.

Buying your first home can be an incredibly exciting time. However, it also requires a huge commitment and investment, and can have repercussions in your life for years to come. Thats why I want to share my three top tips to help first-time homebuyers protect themselves during this crucial period: 1. Know what you can afford The fact is, your mortgage is only a part of what you will need to pay when you buy a home. Homeownership comes with other expenses as well, including closing costs, taxes, property insurance, maintenance costs, and homeowner association fees. Once you have a clear idea of all of these items, you can compare this to your stable income and your current monthly expenses. This way, you can figure out the kind of home you can honestly afford, without getting carried away, and without getting bogged down in debt. 2. Choose your lender wisely Choosing a lender is not something you should base only on the lowest rate. A competent and trustworthy lender will offer you advice on how to improve your credit. The right lender will also help you take advantage of special homebuyer programs that might benefit you. And ideally, your lender will work with you to get pre-approval for your loan. This can strengthen your offer immensely, particularly in hot markets like the one we're seeing around Portland. So how do you find the right lender specifically for you? While it can be a good idea to start shopping online, it's often best to get recommendations from friends who have already worked with a lender, or from a real estate agent you trust. 3. Don't overlook the details There are many details that go into buying a home, and missing any of them can be a costly mistake. For example, I always advise buyers to get a professional inspection (this is separate from an appraisal, which the seller is likely to get). Yes, an inspection will set you back about $300, but it can save you thousands of dollars down the line, and it can even prevent you from making a decision to buy a home that you would later regret. A second example is understanding the fine print in the various contracts you will be signing. If there's anything that isn't clear to you, talk to your real estate agent and have it spelled out. Trust me there are no dumb questions. The process of buying a home can be intimidating, and that's why professional real estate agents are there to help. These three quick tips are only the start of the things you need to watch out for when buying your first home. If you are simply curious about the kinds of homes that are available on the Portland market right now, check out this complete listing: Click here to see all Portland homes for sale And if you need more advice, or you are ready to start looking for a home, get in touch with me at (503) 748-8310. I love working with first-time homebuyers, and I can help you get to your perfect new home with minimum hassle.

link.title: What Advice Do We Have for First-Time Homebuyers?

entry.title: What Advice Do We Have for First-Time Homebuyers?
entry.content:
Buying your first home can be an incredibly exciting time. However, it requires a huge commitment and a sizable investment. Thats why I want to share my three top tips to help first-time homebuyers protect themselves during this crucial period:

Looking to buy a Portland home? Search all homes for sale here.
Looking to sell your Portland home? Use our free home evaluation tool here.

Ive long been interested in international real estate and I have many connections with Realtors all over the world.

This month, with the help of a great local real estate company, we have sold my mothers home in the United Kingdom, as she is about to go into assisted living. Its been an interesting process because things are done a little differently here.

For one, the buyers are called applicants, and they are not legally represented here the same way they are in America.


In the United Kingdom, real estate agents dont have to be licensed.
   


In the U.K., real estate agents dont have to be licensed, and one in three transactions fail. You have to use solicitors and attorneys. The whole process takes approximately three months.

That said, my mothers 3-bed, 1-bathroom, 1,100 square foot bungalow sold for the equivalent of about $330,000.

So, let us know if you know anyone who is interested in buying or selling a home. We can help them meet their goals anywhere in the world. We look forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: 10 Things to Consider When Making an Offer on a Home
entry.content:
There are 10 main factors to consider when making an offer on a home. Taking into account these factors will only make your offer stronger.


Looking to buy a Portland home? Search all homes for sale here.
Looking to sell your Portland home? Use our free home evaluation tool here.

When making an offer on a home, there are 10 factors that you need to consider so that the offer is as good as it can be:

1. Price. We tend to think of the listing price as being the proper price, but this isnt the case. You have to think about whats a good price for you, and what value really means to you. The key is to be flexible depending on what research your Realtor provides you.

2. The earnest money. This sum is normally 1% to 2% of the sales price. If we have the flexibility to put some more earnest money down, that will be looked at favorably by the seller.

3. The down payment. With a lot of financing, we can offer a really low down payment. The more you can put down, the stronger your offer is going to look.

4. The closing date. Its important to work with your Realtor and determine what a good closing date would be for both you and the seller. If theres some flexibility you can give to satisfy the needs of the seller, all the better.

5. The lender. Your pre-qualification is very important, but its also important who you use for a lender. Using an online or out-of-state source as your lender is a red flag for most listing agents. You have to have a good, credible source of finance.

Sellers prefer to deal with people that they like.


6. The possession date. Working out a possession date that is beneficial for both you and the seller will help enormously, especially if you need to work out a rent-back agreement.

7. The inspection. These are critical in ensuring that what youre buying is a good, sound property. Sellers can develop anxiety over this process, and they want to feel that its done in a timely fashion.

8. The appraisal. Appraisals that can be done quickly can help the overall presentation of the offer.

9. Concessions. You as a buyer may need to make a few concessions, such as closing costs, to close the deal. You also have to construct these carefully so they arent viewed negatively by the seller.

10. The credibility of both you and your agent. Sellers like to deal with people they like. Time and time again, weve seen sellers accept offers that were inferior in price to other offers simply because they liked that particular buyer better. They will also gravitate toward a Realtor that theyre comfortable with.

If you or anyone you know is looking to buy or sell real estate and values good representation, wed love to speak to them. Just give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to hearing from you!

link.title: 10 Things to Consider When Making an Offer on a Home

entry.title: What Did the Collapse of the Housing Market Teach Us About Real Estate?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Now that the financial crisis is far behind us, there's no better time to take a deep breath and really look at the lessons we've learned from it.

The first thing one can take away from the housing collapse is the fact that a home is not always an investment. Most homes that are purchased are for personal use. As far as statistics go, right now is a wonderful time to buy, but just know that if the market turns, your home is not guaranteed to be worth more money than when you bought it.

Because a home is such a large purchase, and a market turn can hurt your equity, it's crucial to have an emergency fund. Even if the market doesn't turn, there are all kinds of unexpected things that can happen in life that might affect your ability to make payments on your home. Emergency funds will allow you to survive the tough times.
The market crash also showed us that we should beware of risky mortgages. There are a number of mortgages that offer all kinds of benefits and allow you to borrow a lot more money than you can afford. Luckily, the ability to fog a mirror is no longer enough to get you a loan, but you still need to be careful when applying!

Remember, lenders will likely approve you for more money than you really need. Buy a home that you can comfortably afford to make payments on. You don't want to purchase a home that is going to take you to your loan limit!

Homeownership isn't for everyone. I am passionate about the opportunities it affords, but if the finances and commitment just aren't there, you have no reason to rush into purchasing a home! Figure out what is right for you before you get yourself involved in something over your head.

If you have any questions about homeownership and whether it's right for you, don't hesitate to reach out to us. We would love to hear from you!

link.title: What Did the Collapse of the Housing Market Teach Us About Real Estate?

entry.title: How Can You Avoid Stress When Selling Your Portland Home?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

The home selling process can be stressful, but it doesn't have to be. Today, we want to share a few tips to help you not only survive it, but thrive during it!

 Start packing up things you don't use right away. As soon as you know you're selling, you need to start collecting things that you don't use very often and getting them ready for the road.

 Next, you need to completely declutter your home. Find stuff you no longer want or need and get it out of the house! You might be surprised by how much stuff you own that no longer serves any purpose in your life!

Make sure you clean your home as best you can before and during the selling process. You want it to look like a five-star hotel. We've seen squeaky-clean homes go for as much as $5,000-$10,000 more!

 Maintain your privacy and security when selling. If you want to avoid some frustrating situations, make sure you work with an agent with high standards for showing the home and avoid leaving highly valuable items lying around.

 Finally, to make the selling process a breeze, get the kids involved! Make the moving process fun for the whole family by encouraging the kids to help in the moving effort.

 We want the process to be as easy as possible for you. Give us a call if you need our assistance. We would love to help you!

entry.title: How Can You Improve Your Portland Home Search?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Today I want to talk to you about some things you should consider when searching for a new home in Portland. There are some important factors to pay attention to when looking for a good home, and we want you to be ready to ask questions about them when it comes time for your agent to start showing you homes.
The first thing to pay attention to is the neighborhood and the area. What me and my team do is look at the home and consider the area it's in, and what the resale value for that particular property in that particular area will be. Some neighborhoods are appreciating consistently at a healthy level, and others are not. Seek out this info from your Realtor so they can provide demographics that will help you. You can't beat inside knowledge!

Another thing you should pay attention to are the schools. Even if you don't have kids, the chances are that future buyers will want to be in a good district if they do, it may affect your home's future value. People often clamor to a certain area because of a good school, and it plays a big role in your home's value, especially to families.

 Utility cost is another thing youll want to know about. Certain homes have energy efficient appliances that will help save on utility costs.

 Finally, check how old the roof is. Even if it looks good from the outside, if its been up for 10 or 12 years, you will have to replace it at some point in the near future. The cost to replace a roof is significant, as is the cost to replace a furnace. Talk to your Realtor about a home warranty, which can take away a lot of the risk during a home purchase. With a home warranty, you wont have to fork over a ton of extra cash if something goes wrong in the home. 

 If you or someone you know is interested in buying or selling in Portland, or has a question for us, feel free to give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: The Truth About Securing a Home Loan
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Today, I want to talk to you about how easy it is to get into real estate and secure a loan. I'm passionate about real estate, and I want to help as many people as possible find their next home.

I was dismayed at the recent results of a survey. It seems many people think that getting into real estate is more difficult than it actually is. The survey found that most people believe you need a credit score of 780 in order to qualify for a loan. On top of that, 45% of people surveyed believed that you need to put 20% down, which is a mighty chunk.

The reality is that it's not that difficult to get into the real estate market. For an FHA loan, the average credit score needed is 689. For conventional loans, you need a score of 757. As you can see, the actual credit score requirements are lower than people think. Most people don't put 20% down, either!

Here's where I need your help. If you know anyone who thinks it's difficult to get a loan, I really want to talk to them. There are many fantastic reasons for owning real estate, and no one should be waiting to get into the market due to these misconceptions. If you know anyone who needs help, please refer them to us.

As always, if you have any questions about today's video or real estate in general, give us a call or send us an email. We would love to help you!

entry.title: How Is Real Estate Different in the U.S. and the U.K.?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Hey there everyone, I am coming to you today from a town called Keswick, in the North of England, and it's a pretty brisk day. We wanted to talk a little bit about real estate on a global level. Being here in England, it got me thinking about how fortunate we are to do business in the United States. 

Here in England, real estate works differently. They don't have the MLS, and it's not as easy for brokers and agents to cooperate with each other. It's also harder to expose a property here like we do in the states, and the ethical standards among agents is more rigid. We also have better tax advantages in the U.S., along with the real estate being cheaper. 

If you have any questions for me, or are interested in international real estate, give me a call or send me an email. I'd be happy to give you a hand, no matter where you plan on buying or selling your next home!

entry.title: What 5 Tips Do We Have for Home Buyers?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform a full home search 
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Hey there everyone, today we are going to talk about the five most important things to consider when you are looking for a home to purchase here in Portland. These are simple tips and tricks that may help you secure your dream home sometime in the near future. Here are the five things to consider:

1. Rely on your Realtor for information
This is especially important if you are unfamiliar with a city or neighborhood. When we look at homes with buyers, we also like to think of the home's resale value down the road and what kind of factors could make it difficult. 

2. Schools
There are certain schools in Portland that are more desirable than others. This makes school districts an important factor in your move, and may limit your home search.

3. The size of the home
Before you decide to buy a home, you need to answer a few questions about its size. Will it be big enough for your family? What if your family grows? It may look nice and big when empty, but the way the home looks with all your things in it showcases its true size. 

4. Research
Do your research carefully. See what the property taxes are like in the area, and whether the home is a part of a Homeowners Association or not. 

5. Maintenance. 
Make sure you do consult with a Realtor to make sure the things you are adding add value in the long term. 


If you remember these 5 things, you will have a successful home purchase here in Portland. If you have any questions, you can always reach out to us via phone or email. We are here to help!

entry.title: What First-Time Home Buyers Can't Miss Out On
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.
  
Today I am speaking to the first-time home buyer. If you are out there looking to purchase your first home, you probably have your sights set on a starter home. There's also a good chance that you've remained in a rental situation much longer than you would have preferred, and have grown tiresome of your current living arrangements. Fortunately, as a first-time home buyer, you'll find yourself with very favorable market conditions!

Interest rates have fallen to an extremely low level. We expect them to jump by at least a percent in 2015, but they haven't done so yet. They have actually come down further than we predicted, giving the first-time home buyer more buying power, plenty more than they expected to have.

This tremendous opportunity won't last long. There is a small window of opportunity to buy more home now than you would be able to otherwise. Unless you are expecting a big jump in your income this next year, now is the time to talk to a lender, hear all your mortgage options, and take advantage of these low interest rates.

If you are in search of a good, reputable lender, we have just the referrals for you. Get in touch with us so we can connect you to a great lender. We can also do a buyer consultation with you and show you how to get the best value out of your transaction.

If you have any questions, feel free to give us a call or send us an email. We would love to help you out.

link.title: What First-Time Home Buyers Can't Miss Out On

entry.title: Debunking the Myths About the Holiday Selling Season in Portland
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.


The fall is in full swing and the holiday season is almost upon us. With the leaves dropping and the cold weather setting in, many agents take this time of year to kick back, relax, and take a vacation. The Hatch Homes Group, on the other hand, takes this time to kick it into second gear.

Many sellers who had trouble selling in the summer months have become discouraged and want to wait until the spring to try again. They either want to wait for the holiday season to end before selling or they feel there aren't enough buyers in the market to sell their home fast and for top dollar. Today, we want to dispel the myth that selling in the fall and winter cannot be profitable. Here are 4 reasons why:
  1. Focused buyers: Sure, there are fewer buyers now than in the warmer months, but the buyers who look during the fall and winter are more serious and ready to purchase. Many of them need to move before Christmas or have been relocated for work and are in a hurry to find a place. 
  2. Inventory is low: Although it depends on the particular market, we are seeing conditions that generally favor sellers. Come spring, all the sellers who decided to wait are going to put their homes on the market at the same time. Now is an ideal time to sell because there isn't much competition.
  3. Fantastic interest rates: Many analysts thought interest rates would be around 5% by this time. However, rates have lowered recently, which means borrowing money is quite affordable. We're not sure what rates will do next year, so buyers are excited about the opportunity to take advantage of these low rates.
  4. Prices are moderating: At the beginning of the year, we had a 30% appreciation rate year over year. That has fallen to a more stable 7%. We're not sure what will happen next year, but we're not expecting prices to rise.
As you can see, the holiday season is full of great opportunities for sellers. It's a great market to sell your home quickly and for top dollar. We would love to help you do just that, so give us a call or shoot us an email. We look forward to helping you take advantage of this wonderful market!

link.title: Debunking the Myths About the Holiday Selling Season in Portland

entry.title: Should I Have Sold My Home in the Hot Spring Market?
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.


People often don't get their home ready to sell by the time the spring selling season comes around. When this happens, they will sometimes wait a whole year before selling their home, thinking the best way to maximize their results is to sell in the hot spring market. This way of thinking is a little misguided.

The great thing about late summer and early fall is we typically see another round of buying activity. It's not quite as fast paced as spring, but right now there are still more buyers out there than there are homes on the market.

Even in a slower market your home will sell if it is priced right and in good condition. We can help you make it happen this fall, so give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to give you a hand.

entry.title: Consider These 5 Key Points Before Selling Without An Agent
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

For Sale by Owner Properties- 5 Key Points

Today I am going to speak to you about For Sale by Owner Properties (FSBO). A number of these factors are outlined in this booklet if you're interested in learning more. However, there are a few key points that I want to make about these types of properties.
  1. You're Missing Out on Exposure: If your listing as FSBO, your missing a lot of exposure. Listing with a Realtor can give you 20-30 times more exposure on your home, which is critical in selling it. Realtors have large networks to utilize, and these will absolutely benefit you in the sale of your home.
  2. You Will Not Save Money without a Realtor: There is a common myth that you can save yourself money by listing as FSBO. This may be true in a small fraction of cases, but for the most part you will be missing out on a top dollar sale. Sellers think that they can save money on commission, but buyers looking at FSBO properties think the exact same way, so they assume they can offer 5-7% less than your asking price. Also, a Realtor will net you more money for your home using professional marketing and negotiating techniques.
  3. Security & Protection: You need a professional to represent your best interests in a scenario like this. The most litigious area of real estate is the For Sale By Owner market. Realtors have errors & omissions insurance, as well as a code of ethics that prevents these types of situations from arising.
  4. Objectivity: It's difficult to be objective when you're selling your own home. Realtors act as a professional buffer and can make decisions without getting entangled in emotions. They also work in your best interests to provide you with a no-nonsense approach to selling your home for the most money and in the shortest amount of time.
  5. Realtors Work Together: There is a huge body of Realtors out in the world, as well as here in Portland, and their main goal is to help you succeed. If you're selling as a FSBO, this army of Realtors will be working directly against you, and your chances for getting a satisfactory sale diminish significantly.
There is one last thing I'd like to tell you: The National Association of Realtors reports that you will net 17% less money when you sell your home yourself. So, if getting top dollar and selling quickly is your goal, strongly consider hiring a professional Realtor.

For more information on the pros and cons of selling For Sale By Owner, email john@hatchhomes.com for a copy of my handout explaining why FSBO properties are a financial risk to you.

link.title: Consider These 5 Key Points Before Selling Without An Agent

entry.title: Market Your Home Online to Capture a Visual Audience
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

How to Prepare Your Home for a Spring Sale in Portland
With spring here and the flowers in bloom, you will want to take advantage of this natural beauty and use it to market and sell your property. I have a few tips here for you that should help you to get your property ready for sale.
  1. Use Good Photographs: Most people look for homes online, so you will need a professional-quality photograph of your home in order to stand out from the crowd. Avoid grainy, dull photos and go for colorful, crisp, and clear images that accentuate the great features in your home. If you have a good view, make sure to market it in the photos for your home. Give buyers the very best feel for your home that you can provide through these images.
  2. Consider doing a home tour with a video: Put as much of your home online as possible. Clean up your home and give it a walk through with a camera to show off the dimensions of your home. Less people are coming to house showings because they can view your property from their computer. When you provide this kind of convenience to a consumer, it can pay off.
    • We can also use drones to give the viewer a good feel of the property if a home has a large yard or lots of land on it. These are good ways to impress a buyer not only with nice aerial features of your home, but also with dramatic presentation. 
The first 5 people to respond to this video will get a free photographer to come and take professional-quality pictures of their home. This is a very easy, cheap way to stand out from the crowd if you're thinking of selling. Don't miss out on this excellent opportunity.
So, feel free to contact us with any questions about staging your home to sell, or about Portland real estate in general. We are always here to help you.

link.title: Market Your Home Online to Capture a Visual Audience

entry.title: What to Expect from an Exciting Portland Real Estate Market
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

As we approach the first quarter of 2014, I think it's time that I give you a market update for Portland real estate. Here are a few things to take away:

  • Last year we saw a healthy 13% increase in prices and saw inventory drop, causing a favorable market for sellers.
  • However, the current S&P report is predicting a slowdown in real estate nationwide. They reported 2 months of price decreases which are small and seasonable, but nonetheless, they are significant.
  • This report is significant when you factor in the average days on market decreased for Portland by 10%, and inventory also jumped in that time period.
  • I see sellers stalling and waiting for the spring and summer to put their home on the market in the hope that things will turn around by then, but I don't think these wishes are going to come to fruition.
    • There will be an increase in inventory in Portland this spring and summer, and maybe an increase in interest rates as well.
If I was a seller, I'd be putting my home on the market and making the most of what we've got right now. So, if you know anyone trying to sell, or trying to buy, please have them contact us because we would love to help them. Consider us your resource for real estate in Portland.

link.title: What to Expect from an Exciting Portland Real Estate Market

entry.title: Portland Real Estate: How to be successful in Todays Changing 2014 Market
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Portland, Oregon? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price  Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (503) 974-4104 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Hello again and welcome back to my blog. I'm excited to discuss what happened in 2013 and also what we can expect to happen in 2014.
  • In 2013 prices rose by 13% and short sales and foreclosures on properties went down as well. Inventory was also at record lows because of investors coming in and buying properties.
  • In 2014 I think we can expect a much more moderate rise in prices as well as a rise in interest rates (up to 5.4%).
  • Buyers during this year will experience unprecedented affordability with low interest. Mortgages are expected to make up 13% of a consumer's income this year, as opposed to 16-17% for 2013.
  • Sellers right now will experience the benefits of a very low inventory, so you can expect to receive multiple offers and garner a good value for your property. However, inventory won't remain this low for very long, so now is your chance.
These are some of the things you can expect to see in the Portland Real Estate market this year, barring any cataclysmic shifts in the market.

As always, we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Call me at (503) 974-4104 or email at John@HatchHomes.com

entry.title: 6 Reasons to Sell During the Holidays
entry.content:
Welcome back to my video blog. Lately, a lot of people have asked whether the holidays are a good time to sell. Now is actually a great time to sell and I have six reasons why.
  1. There is less competition - Because fewer people list during the holidays, your home has less competition.
  2. Buyers are serious - Nobody wants to take time out of their holiday plans to look at homes unless they need to buy.
  3. Buyers have end of the year motivation - Some buyers are relocating or need to buy by the end of the year.
  4. Interest rates are fantastic. 
  5. Median prices are up - They have increased 13.9 percent this year. That means more money for your home.
  6. It is cheaper to buy than rent.
Homes also look great during the holidays. If you are thinking about selling, give me a call. Let's talk about your situation.

link.title: 6 Reasons to Sell During the Holidays

entry.title: November 2013 Market Update
entry.content:
Welcome back to our video blog. We want to be your real estate resource and thats why we have the latest information on whats happening in the real estate market.

According to the National Realtors Association the annual projected home sales price increased to 5.29 million, while national median home price dropped 3.5 percent.

The national average interest rate for a 30-year fixed loan is 4.28 percent.

If you would like to know how these statistics affect our local Portland market, please give me a call.

Thanks for watching!

entry.title: How to Keep Your Home Safe While on Vacation
entry.content:
Welcome back to my video blog! Today, we are on vacation and that prompted us with todays topic keeping your home safe while you are away. Here are a few tips to make sure your home is protected.
  1. Dont post anything on social media. 
  2. Cancel your newspaper and your mail. 
  3. Don't leave a car in the driveway.
  4. Hire someone to maintain your lawn.
  5. Dont hide a spare key. 
  6. Ask a neighbor to watch your home.
  7. Install a security system.
  8. Shut your blinds.
  9. Have lights on a timer.
  10. Turn your phone volume down.
I hope you find these tips helpful and they give you some peace of mind while you are on your wonderful vacation! Thanks for watching!

link.title: How to Keep Your Home Safe While on Vacation

entry.title: Keller Williams Mobile App
entry.content:
Welcome back to my video blog. I am so excited to tell you about our new Keller Williams mobile app. It is a remarkable tool.

It will use your location to tell you where all the active listings are near you. A map will pull up and you can click each listing. Then, information such as the price and number of bedrooms is available. The information is constantly updated from the MLS.

When you download the app, it will ask you for an agent code. Enter KW2F3AMLR
If you have questions about any specific properties, let us know. We can find out more for you!

Thanks for watching!

entry.title: This Month in Real Estate: September 2013
entry.content:
Thanks for visiting my real estate blog. I wanted to give you an update on the national statistics for September. Homes sales are projected at 5.4 million, which is down about .25 percent. However, it is still up 13.7 percent from this time last year. The average national interest rate for a 30 year fixed rate mortgage is at 4.58 percent.

If you have any questions about our local market, give us a call! Wed love to help!

link.title: This Month in Real Estate: September 2013

entry.title: What Can a Seller Do to Prepare Their Home for the Market?
entry.content:
Hello, everyone. Thanks for joining me today.

Sellers ask all the time what they can do to get their home ready for the market. Well, the first thing you should look at is your curb appeal. How does your home look on the outside? Hiring a professional landscaper can make a tremendous difference for minimum cost.

Once you have the outside up to par, what about the inside of your home? We have found homes that are professionally staged sell much quicker and for a better price than properties similar that werent.

We also recommend getting a home inspection prior to listing. This way you can be prepared and not have any surprises when it comes time to close your home.

Every home is different, so if you have any questions about how to get your home ready please give us a call. We give free consultations and can get you ready to list your home.

link.title: What Can a Seller Do to Prepare Their Home for the Market?

entry.title: Changing Interest Rates in the Real Estate Market
entry.content:
How Do Increasing Interest Rates Affect Our Market?

Hello, everyone. Thank you for joining me today.

As many of you know, weve experienced an increase of about one percentage point over the past 6-8 weeks. Because of the recent change, we have seen fewer investors in the market, as well as fewer multiple offer situations.

The market is still fantastic, though. Interest rates are still historically low and they will increase again. Now, is the time for buyers to make their move! Its important to get prequalified before looking at homes; it lets the seller know you are a serious buyer.

Its a great time for sellers as well because there is very little inventory. Your home will have fewer competitors.

Thank you for watching! If you have any questions about our real estate market, please give me a call!

link.title: Changing Interest Rates in the Real Estate Market

entry.title: Setting the Right Price for Your Home
entry.content:
Interested in selling your home? Click here to see our Market Snapshot!

Hello everyone; its so good to be with you again.

Pricing a property properly is one of the most important aspects when selling your home. Many sellers think if they price their home above market value they will get offers around that asking price.

Currently, in our market, the difference between list and sale price is 99 percent. That means sellers are getting 99 percent of what they are asking for. Buyers now are educated and for the most part know when a home is priced fairly. They are willing to make a full price offer if the home condition matches the asking price.

How do you determine what the best price for your home is? Here at Hatch Homes we provide a market analysis. We do a total market overview, breaking down the different regions and their price ranges. Through this we are able to see exactly how many pending sales there are, how many homes are on the market, what homes are selling the best, etc. With this information we can find the perfect price for your home.

link.title: Setting the Right Price for Your Home

entry.title: Portland, Oregon June 2013 Market Update
entry.content:
To learn more about what's happening in the current Portland real estate market, call us at 503.974.4104 or email at john@hatchhomes.com.

There have been some exciting changes in the market lately. Currently there is a 2.5 month inventory which has led to some great sale prices. In fact, sales have increased for the past 21 consecutive months and sale prices the last 13 consecutive months.

These are all signs of a healthy market. But with increasing sales and little inventory comes challenges. Sellers need to price properly to sell their home quickly.
